title: Easy to Use
text: I have had this camera for well over a year now and it has gotten even better. They have updated the software for the app and it’s amazing. The latest update which is the reason for the review, is you can save favorite angles the camera is pointing. No more manually tilting and paning to get my favorite angles. I just hit that angle and it goes right to it, amazing!

title: Good camera when I first bought it but quality of the picture has been declining with each update
text: My Nc220 and NC230 were crystal clear when I purchased several months ago but are now highly pixelated pictures with any movement. I bought this so I could watch my 85 year old mother take her medications as she had a big problem with adherence which landed her in the ER and short term care a number of times.  Since I simplified her medication regime and started watching her on the “Pill Cam” she has been fully compliant, her blood pressure is totally under control and no more ER visits.  While the camera is still useful for monitoring my mom, I would like my clearer picture back.  It has gotten so bad that at times she looks like The Thing from the Fantastic Four.

title: Easy cam management
text: Tplink cam app has turned into a stable and easy to use app. I recommend using it.

title: Good when it works
text:
Granted living in a 2 story apartment made of concrete will do no favors for WiFi. We have a 5G setup and TP link repeater made for a space 5x of what we have. 

All that said the app does what it’s supposed to most of the time. One of my cameras has direct line of sight to the router and it’ll drop signal or the app will just hang several times per week. Not sure if that’s the app or camera firmware but I’d say the whole ecosystem needs some work. Kinda hard to beat for the price point though. 

I wouldn’t recommend the app or cameras on WiFi for a business but for a baby cam or home install it’ll work just fine. Good enough reason to tell your wife to stop obsessing over the stupid camera and get some sleep.

June 5th update. 
Neither camera will tether to the router. Wired the cam to router, tried WPS, nothing. Setup for the moment is completely useless.

title: App update breaks the camera!
text: Recent update has broken the camera! It shows up as “Live” for a few moments, then says “no updates for 30 days” and won’t show me a live view. Last pic shows a Christmas tree in my house, so it was from back around Christmas. So appears it was the recent update (3.1.4) causing an issue with my NC290 camera.

title: Works great, ....but
text:
I don’t care for the new interface. There are many new buttons and choices, but it seems to just make it more complicated. 
I would love to display it on my TV but the larger image appears sideways and the only available control flips it 180 degrees.

title: iPad Review
text: This app never gets better. From the initial screen, I see all of my cams. I have 4 TP-Link cams, but I can only view one Live cam at a time. I’d like to see all four Live. The settings are repetitive. And worst of all, I can’t adjust the time interval for email alerts because the app is designed with a scroll bar that cannot be scrolled on an iPad.

title: Great use
text: This work very good in my company

I keep getting notifications through the day but its of no use as i cant view the images/video

To say this app is unreliable would be an understatement.

title: Awesome system
text: If you have ever wanted a camera that does everything but you don't want to pay the steep prices or pay for monitored security, go for this company. Their app is intuitive and the camera is awesome and high def. I can even speak into it and have my dog at home hear me. Highly recommend!

title: Very buggy
text: Very buggy

title: Why screw up a working feature?
text:
Checking and viewing recorded data was fast, responsive, intuitive and easy. Amazingly the developers managed to break all of that at once.  The timeline that you scroll to and then pinch or stretch and then push play in several times until it finally quits timing out is nether fast, responsive or easy and only has a brief flirtation with intuitive.

June 12.

Nice job with the sudden flurry of fake positive reviews.  With the latest patch you now cannot even remotely manage the camera.  Why not just roll back to the pre-April app?

title: Works now with update
text: Downloaded app and set up camera, was working fine. Then opened up camera on computer and could no longer view on phone! Would not show up no matter how many times I reset it or even change all the admin setting and re add it to my cloud account! Working fine now with new update

title: Fast and easy to install.
text: I would say download the app plug the Internet cord into the device turn on the power turn on the app. Follow instructions in less than five minutes should be up and running.

title: To-link camera
text: This outfit is a joke. Got a cloud camera with a to-link router and tried to set it up.  The instructions are barely literate, to say the least, and woefully skimpy.  After I finally got the camera connected to my home wifi, the software said I needed a "firmware" update.  Of course, the update failed, and there's nobody to talk to about it.  Continual message of "update failed, try again later."  But there is no later.  This is just a piece of crap outfit.  Nobody (at least in the English speaking world) should waste their money on TP-link.

title: Export all photos
text: I love the app, it has a nice design and all of that, but it’s missing a feature that I need ASAP. I would love to be able to export all the photos and all the videos all at once. I have over 100 photos, and I obviously can’t go and export every single one of them individually. I need the option to export all of them to the camera roll or to iCloud Drive or something.

title: Works well
text: Not sure why all the poor reviews. I think this product and app work great. Clear picture, easy to use and amazing given the price vs other products on the market.

title: For some reason always off-line

title: Great Camera, Only Negative is That it Can't Move!
text: The app is great regarding control of the camera, the only downside to the n200 camera is that it's stationary (meaning once placed somewhere it can't move left, right, up, or down. But other than that it seems to be great!

title: Camera NC220
text: Perfect security camera for the price and so easy to setup, bought a trail cam yesterday. Now, planning to buy more TP-link video camera to complete my home security.

title: Works!
text: App is simple and good. Good image quality with remote viewing. I suppose the main credit goes to the TP link cameras - $35 a piece for high quality video is good value !

title: Nice when it still worked
text: Ever since the last firmware upgrade, most of my cameras show up as offline in the app, but work fine via the website. This latest version of the app fixed this for one out of 4 cameras. Still needs a lot more work before being a useful app

title: Loss of cross regional viewing
text:
The loss of cross regional viewing via mobile phone makes this app redundant. No more checking on webcams at home while on the road. Having to find a computer , log on and use the web based version is a waste of time. 
This issue has been going in for months already. Let's get it fixed !

Hope you guys get this right soon otherwise I will be taken down my network and purchasing new cameras. I have over four locations and over 30 cameras altogether.

Please provide me with some support on these 3 issues. Thanks.

title: Works well (with most recent firmware update)
text:
Another firmware update has left my cameras crippled.  Now, my cameras only work if they're directly plugged into my network through a wired connection.  

Please fix this issue! 

---previous review---
I purchased 2 of the $29 cameras on Amazon, thinking it'd be worth the (very small) risk if they didn't work out.  Turns out, I made a good bet.  The cameras were surprisingly simple to set up, and work very well for the price.  Only lingering complaint is that the audio feed from these cameras is not at all usable (just a bunch of clicking static).  The video feed isn't HD, but isn't bad either.

I wanted to post this review to clarify something to those who may be on the fence about these cameras.  Specifically, the "firmware update" people keep referencing.

When I initially purchased these cameras, the app used to view and configure them was fairly outdated.  The cameras worked well, but the app was less-than-stellar.  

Less than a week later, the app was updated (and refreshed) the the variant seen today.  Coupled with that update, was a firmware upgrade. Unfortunately, the firmware update was a fairly crippling one, causing both of my cameras the disconnect after a few hours (and never reconnect unless they were power cycled).

Roughly a week or so later, a second firmware update was made available that resolved this problem (my cams have been holding steady since that date).  

So, in summary - good camera (okay picture, bad audio), good app (that's as of this writing fully functional).  Fully worth the price, and recommended for those who desire an economical way to check on the status of their residence when away!
